subject: Relationships
title: The Cult of Domesticity
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Cult of Domesticity.

hook.text: Victorian women were told love meant disappearing. A good wife was invisible, selfless, and silent.

buildup.text: The 'cult of domesticity' idealized women as moral guardians of the home â€” pure, pious, and submissive.

discovery.text: Men occupied the public sphere; women the private. Love was duty, not passion â€” passion was dangerous.

twist.text: Behind closed doors, Victorian women wrote diaries filled with desire, frustration, and rebellion.

climax.text: The Victorian ideal of love was a performance. Real emotions simmered underneath, waiting to explode.

punchline.text: Victorian love was a cage decorated to look like a home.

quiz.question: What was the 'cult of domesticity'?
options: An ideal of women as pure, submissive homemakers
